channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report E-2023080484
item.description:
Report E-2023080484

item.title: Report X-2023070467
item.description:
Report X-2023070467

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-15
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Car began leaking from the middle hopper door as it was going over the hump. Car man secured the door which was less than 1" open. The car was set out and inspected and seals were on all hopper doors and the dogs were operational. The car was diverted back to El Dorado Chemical.

item.title: Report X-2023080517
item.description:
Report X-2023080517

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-29
  • City: MABELVALE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged fully regulated package was found in loading work area DescribePack: Upon inspection one of the cans of white paint had a loose cap which had caused an internal leakage inside of the box DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged fully regulated package was placed inside of a hazmat plastic bag

item.title: Report X-2023080510
item.description:
Report X-2023080510

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: FORT SMITH
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered during the unloading of the trailer about mid-way through unloading the packages stacked on top of the flaps. The package was placed inside of hazmat tote and placed out due to the smell of the paint. DescribePack: 1 of 3 of the paint cans lids was loose and bent leaving at small hold for the liquid the spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was place upright.
